text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Morocco welcomes nomination of former Secretary of State James Baker as U.N. envoy in Western Sahara.
- Benin withdraws recognition of self-styled Saharan Arab Democratic Republic (SADR) claiming sovereignty over Western Sahara.
- Gabon's President Omar Bongo visits Morocco.
- King Hassan tells international water forum "water challenge will be crucial next years".
- Fuel station workers to go on one-day strike on Monday.
- European Union Fisheries Commissioner Emma Bonino says decision to extend cephalopods resting period to allow them to recover to four from inital two months, taken in accord with Morocco.
- International water forum agrees to devise global strategy to rationalise use of water.
